DISPOSABLE.Definition: dismissed or not followed after a while

INTRINSICALLY.Definition: in a way that is a very important and basic characteristic of them

LABEL.Definition: a piece of paper or other material giving information about it

DRESSMAKER.Definition: someone whose job was to make your dresses

HOUSEHOLD.Definition: the house and people who live together in it

EPONYMOUS.Definition: having given his name to the fashion house

COMPLEX.Definition: involving a lot of different parts, complicated

OVER-ENGINEERED.Definition: having more details than necessary, too complicated

CORSETS.Definition: tight pieces of underwear worn from below the chest to the hips, to shape the figure

FRILLS.Definition: narrow pieces of cloth with a lot of folds that were attached or sewn to the edge of a dress as decoration

BOY-LIKE.Definition: having the shape of a boy

ANDROGYNOUS.Definition: partly male and partly female in appearance

WIDE-LEGGED.Definition: trousers with very wide legs throughout their whole length

STRIPED.Definition: having long narrow lines or strips

ASPIRATION.Definition: things that they hoped to achieve

SHOW OFF.Definition: show or display something in order to get attention

NAUTICAL.Definition: relating to the look of sailors

LOOSE FITTING.Definition: not fitting tightly or very close to the body

CAUGHT HER EYE.Definition: made her pay attention to it

TWEED.Definition: a rough outdoor cloth originally produced in Scotland.

WOVEN.Definition: made by using threads and needle, knitted

HAUTE COUTURE.Definition: expensive, fashionable clothes produced by famous fashion houses

PORTER.Definition: a person whose job is to carry the travellers' bags

LUGGAGE.Definition: bags and suitcases people used when they were travelling

EMBARGO.Definition: an official ban on or stop to trade with a particular country

INTERLOCKING.Definition: having parts joined or fit together

COUNTERINTUITIVELY.Definition: contrary to what one would expect, not according to common sense

HOLDINGS COMPANY.Definition: a company that doesn't sell anything and whose purpose is to control and  own shares of other companies

RATIONED.Definition: limited to a fixed amount for each person

A SHADOW OF ITS FORMER SELF.Definition: in a much worse state than it was before

FERTILISER.Definition: substances that were used on the land to make plants grow faster and well

CUT HIS TEETH.Definition: got his first practice or experience

SET OUT ON HIS OWN.Definition: he began to work by himself

FOCUSSED ON.Definition: given a lot of attention to

PRACTICALITY.Definition: the quality of being useful or functional

RATIONING.Definition: limited amount available to each person

SEIZED UPON.Definition: accepted and used right away with excitement

SUCCESSOR.Definition: someone who would continue his work after his death

TENURE.Definition: the period of time during which he owned it

POWERHOUSE.Definition: a very successful and famous company

DEAD BY HIS OWN HAND.Definition: as a result of his own actions, having committed suicide

IT GOES WITHOUT SAYING.Definition: it is obvious or generally accepted

TRICKLE-DOWN EFFECT.Definition: relating to the idea that fashion trends move from the higher classes to the lower classes in society, in a way that everyone is affected

CANVAS.Definition: a strong rough cloth used by artists for painting on
